page.title: 02LLANSTEFFAN VILLAGE
page.content: The village is a designated Conservation Area. Dominated by the Norman castle on its headland above the Tywi estuary, the village is clustered round the ancient church with its 13th Century tower. Most of the 230 dwellings are 19th Century or earlier, stonebuilt and rendered with slate roofs, and wellpreserved. Beside the shore is The Green, a row of houses facing across the estuary. Some of the 20 Council houses have recently been bought by their tenants. There are 15 Council bungalows for old people, with a visiting warden. The Plas is a Georgian manor house built on a mediaeval site. Because many of its inhabitants work in Carmarthen, Llansteffan has a slight air of a commuter village, but this is offset by its strongly rural origins.
